questions.question: What is an Appian best practice for calling a query on your interface?
options: Call the query once on a local variable.
Call the query everywhere you need it to show data.
Call the query once on a rule input.
questions.answer: Call the query once on a local variable.

questions.question: You created an expression rule that was deployed to production on January 12, 2022. The object has form type as a rule input, as well as several other rule inputs for characteristics describing the logged in user. Given values for these inputs, the rule returns a set of form instructions for the specified type of form as applicable to the logged in user. What is the most important action to take with regards to the object description?
options: Set an object description that reads: Returns a set of form instructions to display, given the type of form and characteristics of the logged in user.

Save a rule input of type text for the object called objectDescription, and set a text value that generally describes the object such that other developers could quickly gain understanding of the objects purpose.

Set an object description that includes any notes you may need if you were to become responsible for providing Production Support on that area of the application in the future. You should also include BP 1/12/2022 Created somewhere in the description.
questions.answer: Set an object description that reads: Returns a set of form instructions to display, given the type of form and characteristics of the logged in user.

questions.question: Which condition must be true in order to establish record type relationships?
options: The record types must have many-to-many relationships.
All record types in the relationship must be backed by an integration.
Data sync must be enabled for the record types.
questions.answer: Data sync must be enabled for the record types.

questions.question: What is the prerequisite configuration for adding a process model into site as a tab?

questions.question: You built a grid field with the data source as a query entity. You want to add a search box to the grid using Appians out-of-the-box functionality. You set the parameter of showSearchBox to True, but the search box is still not appearing. Why is the search box NOT appearing?
options: The search box only appears when data is populated in the grid.
The grid is on an interface that needs to be placed within a report object.
The showSearchBox parameter only applies when a record type is used as the source in the data.
questions.answer: The showSearchBox parameter only applies when a record type is used as the source in the data.

questions.question: You want to replace any invalid email addresses in a list of email addresses with the word invalid. A rule already exists within your application which determines if an email address format is valid: MAIL_isValidEmail(). This rule takes in a single email address and returns either True or False. Which code snippet will return the desired output?
options: A
B
C
questions.answer: C

questions.question: You are updating an interface that is used as part of a User Input Task. The associated process model has an activity chained flow that loops back to the User Input Task. The process follows this flow when the user clicks Save on the interface to submit the task. You need to retain the users selection so that the value remains selected after the user clicks Save. Review the following process model diagram: What is the minimum set of variables and/or inputs that need to be configured to keep the users selection?
options: Rule input, activity class parameter, and a process variable
Local variable and a process variable
Task parameter and a process variable
questions.answer: Local variable and a process variable

questions.question: You are working on an existing process model with three process variables: 1. pv!vehicleID (integer), 2. pv!vehicle(Custom Data Type (CDT), 3. pv!dealershipName (text). You have a script task with an output variable, defined as rule!VIM_getVehicle(vehicleID: pv!vehicleID). The result is saved to pv!vehicle. The rule VIM_getDealershipName() accepts the dealership ID, which is a field on the vehicle CDT, and returns the dealership name. What should you update in the process model to set the value for pv!dealershipName?
options: Move the existing output variable to the inputs tab, and name it vehicle. Add output variable defined as rule!VIM_getDealershipName(ac!vehicle.dealershipId) and save that value to pv!dealershipName.
Add another output variable defined as rule!VIM_getDealershipName(pv!vehicle.dealershipId) and save that value to pv!dealershipName.
Add a new script task, and add an input variable defined as rule!VIM_getDealershipName(ac!vehicle.dealershipName) that saves into pv!dealershipName.
questions.answer: Add another output variable defined as rule!VIM_getDealershipName(pv!vehicle.dealershipId) and save that value to pv!dealershipName.

questions.question: You are creating a large, complex interface Which statement describes a best practice for strategizing code organization?
options: Create individual interface objects for each chunk of code that is logically grouped, especially for those that may be reused in other areas of the application.

Create only one interface object per developer assigned to the feature. This balances the performance cost of calling additional interface objects with the need to prevent developers from overwriting each other.
Since the components are related, all code should be centralized in a single interface object. This minimizes the performance cost incurred by Appian calling multiple interface objects.
questions.answer: Create individual interface objects for each chunk of code that is logically grouped, especially for those that may be reused in other areas of the application.

questions.question: You want to prevent a user from submitting a form when an invalid value is entered. What should you do?
options: Wrap the Text field in an if statement and display a red card layout when the value is not valid.
Use a rich text display field with “STRONG” style and “NEGATIVE” color when the value is not valid.
In the validations parameter, use an if statement that returns a text string when the value is not valid.
questions.answer: In the validations parameter, use an if statement that returns a text string when the value is not valid [3].

questions.question: How should you address the requirement of HR Recruiter group not receiving email notifications for the initial processing of job applications, while HR Supervisor group continues receiving emails?

Update the settings in the Admin Console to disable outbound email from Appian.
Update the HR Recruiter group settings to disable email notifications.

questions.question: Which statement regarding the use of rule inputs for expression rules is true?
options: Only basic data types should be used for rule inputs. Custom Data Types (CDTs) or records should always be queried within the expression rule rather than passed in via rule input.
The data type for rule inputs should be set only for Custom Data Types (CDTs).
If the value passed in via rule input may be a list of numbers, the rule input must be configured as an “Array”.
questions.answer: If the value passed in via rule input may be a list of numbers, the rule input must be configured as an “Array” [8].

questions.question: What is the out-of-the-box behavior that indicates a text input field is required?
options: The size of the label font increases to show significance.
An asterisk (*) appears at the end of the label to notify the user that the field must have a rule.
The label font of the field goes from normal text to bold in order to draw attention.
questions.answer: An asterisk (*) appears at the end of the label to notify the user that the field must have a rule [9].
